body_html:
@drpngx Thanks for your feedback.

As you see, I implemented all the proper formatting changes you suggested.

However the optimizers in TF (i.e., Adam, Adagrad, RMSProp, etc) all have the exact same "code-related" issues you're flagging my code for:

  • argument ordering
  • consts best practices
  • argument indexing
  • code-reuses + quote misuse in validation sections
  • and GPU section formatting

If I implement any of your remaining suggestions in just my code, Nadam will be the only optimizer following these new conventions. I'd prefer not to make Nadam's conventions deviate from all the other optimizers.

Are you open to me re-factoring and modifying all the optimizers in Tensorflow to address your complaints with them?

How about we build, test, and pull this PR first with all the optimizers having uniform conventions for the moment.

I'm happy to help you address these remaining issues separately though. I'm also dissatisfied with how this C++ is organized. Let's flag all these deficiencies you've found (with all the C++ optimizers) in a separate Issue. Give me a shout on that thread and I'll come over and start working on a new branch to refactor all of TF's optimizers. Then I can submit a second PR for that.
